original: Zetterlöf, Gbg, dispaschörsassist. i Gbg sed. 36. Led. av Sv:es adv:samf. sed. 38. *Zetterman, Karl Per Eric, skådespelare, Göteborg, (f. 3/9/86 i Sthlm av konsertsåing. Karl Fredrik Z. o. Char- lotta Forsman. G. 37 m. skådesp. Rosa Rydberg. — Korist v. Oscarsteat. 07, däreft. eng. h. Carl Barcklind, John Liander o. v. Folkteatrarna i Sthlm o. Gbg, anst. v. Stora teat. i Gbg fr. 23. Bl. roller: Don Juan, Almaviva ,i Figa-ros bröllop, Valentin i Faust, översteprästen i Aida, Ström i Muntra fruarna i Windsor, Tomas so i Låglandet, Frank i Läderlappen, Webster i Katja, P3aron Zeta i Den glada änkan, Basil i Greven av Luxemburg, Menelaus i Sköna Helena, Greve Lothar i En valsdröm.
translated:
Zetterlöf, Gbg, dispatcher's assistant in Gothenburg since 1936. Member of the Swedish Lawyers Association since 1938. 

*Zetterman, Karl Per Eric, actor, Gothenburg, (born on September 3, 1886 in Stockholm to concert singer Karl Fredrik Z. and Charlotta Forsman). Married in 1937 to actress Rosa Rydberg. 

Choir member at Oscarsteatern in 1907, later worked with Carl Barcklind, John Liander, and various People's Theaters in Stockholm and Gothenburg. Employed at the Gothenburg Grand Theater from 1923. 

Notable roles include: Don Juan, Almaviva in Figaro's Wedding, Valentin in Faust, high priest in Aida, Ström in The Merry Wives of Windsor, Tomas in The Lowland, Frank in Die Fledermaus, Webster in Katja, Baron Zeta in The Merry Widow, Basil in The Count of Luxembourg, Menelaus in Beautiful Helen, Count Lothar in A Waltz Dream.

Please note that "m. skådesp." and "m. partners name" mean "married to actress" and "married to partner's name" respectively, and the abbreviation "Gbg" refers to Gothenburg.
